metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32250 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high
metadata.Description:
net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c in the Linux kernel through 5.18.1 allows alocal user (able to create user/net namespaces) to escalate privileges toroot because an incorrect NFT_STATEFUL_EXPR check leads to ause-after-free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-37-generic - 5.15.0-37.39
linux-image-5.15.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-37.39
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-37-generic - 5.15.0-37.39
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-37-generic-64k - 5.15.0-37.39
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1010-kvm - 5.15.0-1010.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1011-aws - 5.15.0-1011.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1010-azure - 5.15.0-1010.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1010.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-gcp - 5.15.0-1008.12
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1008.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-37-lowlatency - 5.15.0-37.39
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-37-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-37.39
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1009-oracle - 5.15.0-1009.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1011-oem - 5.17.0-1011.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1011-raspi - 5.15.0-1011.13
linux-image-5.15.0-1011-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1011.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-37.39').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1010.11').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1011.14').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1010.12').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1010.12').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.12').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.10').
linux-gkeop package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1001.2').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1007.8').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.11').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-37.39').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1009.12').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1011.12').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1011.13').
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needs-triage').
